snippet: Miami’s new baseball stadium will test a market that has ranked last in National League attendance for six straight seasons.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column highlights Miami Park baseball stadium, new home to Miami Marlins; holds that the $634 million, retractable-roofed monument to the future is different, just like Miami, and will test a market that has ranked last in National League attendance for six straight seasons.
lead_paragraph: Miami’s new baseball stadium will test a market that has ranked last in National League attendance for six straight seasons.

headline.seo: Marlins’ New Stadium Bets on the Future
headline.main: Marlins Bet on Future in a Florida Theme Park
headline.print_headline: Marlins Bet on Future In a Florida Theme Park
